title: Vigil for FedEx shooting victims held in Indianapolis as eight killed by Brandon Scott Hole are named – The Sun
text:
A VIGIL for the innocent victims of the FedEx shooting has taken place in Indianapolis.

A small crowd gathered in the afternoon to mourn after authorities released the names of the eight people killed by Brandon Scott Hole, 19, who purchased the two assault rifles legally in July and September last year, according to police.

Read our Fedex shooting live blog below for the very latest news and updates...

13 Deandra Dycus led the vigil Credit: Getty Images - Getty

13 Mourners bow their heads and weep during a prayer vigil at Olivet Missionary Baptist Church

13 People whose relatives were hurt or killed due to gun violence gathered in the afternoon Credit: AFP

A group of moms who lost their children to gun violence - from activist group Moms Demand Action - spoke at the vigil to reflect and pray together.

Deandra Dycus, whose 13-year-old son was injured after being hit by a stray bullet, led the vigil.

Addressing the crowd, she said: "It is okay not to be okay and feel free to reach out to any of us in those moments when you are not okay."

The mom and activist added: "To those who haven't been impacted by gun violence directly as we have, I salute you for being here and wanted to stand up to this cause, this monster, this beast, this demon that is terrorising us.

"So I thank you and I appreciate you for joining us in this fight.

"We are doing this in the hope that you will never have to walk in our shoes.

"My heart just goes out to the mums and the families because when we see it, we hurt all over again."

Other vigils are set to take place to honor the victims of the shooting, including one at 7pm.

13 A woman hugs a girl during the vigil Credit: AFP

13 A poem was performed during the vigil in Indianapolis Credit: Getty Images - Getty

It comes as photographs of some of the eight victims were revealed.

In a post by police on Friday evening, the victims were named by Marion County Coroner’s Office (MCCC) as: Matthew R Alexander, 32; Samaria Blackwell, 19; Amarjeet Johal, 66; Jasvinder Kaur, 64; Jaswinder Singh, 68; Amarjit Skhon, 48; Karlie Smith, 19; and John Weisert, 74.

The 19-year-old gunman had been interviewed by agents last year, when his mom expressed concerns and a shotgun was seized from the teenager's home.

13 Eight people were fatally shot at a FedEx facility in Indianapolis on Thursday night – the latest in a string of mass shootings in the U.S. Credit: Reuters

13 Brandon Scott Hole, 19, pictured in an undated photo from police, was identified as the gunman in Thursday night's mass shooting Credit: Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department

Indy Genesis, a homeschool athletic association based in the city, released images of one of its athletes, 19-year-old victim Samaria Blackwell.

According to one of her teammates, “Samaria was always smiling and cracking jokes. She was so loving, goofy, encouraging, and supportive.”

A GoFundMe campaign has now been set up to raise money for the Blackwell family.

A photograph of Amarajeet Kaur Johal, 66, was also circulated by a number of Sikh Facebook pages.

13 Victim Samaria Blackwell, 19, was described as 'loving,' 'goofy,' and 'encouraging' Credit: Facebook

13 Amarjeet Kaur Johal, 66, was among those killed at the FedEx facility Credit: Facebook

At least seven other people were injured during the rampage on Thursday night, which ended with the shooter turning the gun on himself.

It marks the latest in a string of mass shootings across America in recent weeks, also becoming the third mass shooting in Indianapolis this year.

On Friday, the FBI confirmed that it had interviewed Hole last year, after his mother called police to say that her son might commit "suicide by cop."

The call was made in March 2020, and a shotgun was later seized from Hole's residence, the FBI said in a statement.

VICTIMS NAMED

The suspected shooter had purchased the shotgun just 24 hours before he was arrested, according to reports.

Hole was then interviewed in April, when it was deemed that no racially motivated violent extremism (RMVE) ideology had been identified during the assessment.

When he was released, Hole was reportedly deemed no further threat to the community.

According to police, a gunman identified as Hole opened fire at a FexEx facility in Indianapolis on Tuesday night, killing eight people before turning the gun on himself.

13 On Friday, Mary Carol Weisert held up a photo of her husband, John Weisert, whose status was not known at the time Credit: Jon Cherry/Getty Images

13 John Weisert, 74, was confirmed as one of the victims on Friday evening Credit: Jon Cherry/Getty Images

13 The suspected gunman was interviewed by FBI agents last year, authorities said Credit: AP

According to Indianapolis Deputy Chief Craig McCartt, Hole was a former FedEx employee, having last worked for the company in 2020.

McCartt said he did not know why Hole left the job, but family members told FOX59 he was fired.

Authorities said in a press conference on Friday that Hole was also arrested in 2013 – though it was not made clear for what reason.

McCartt said that investigators do not know the motive of the shooting, adding that the gunman carried out the shooting rampage with a rifle, which they do no know if he purchased legally.

Following the shooting, family and friends said they struggled to reach loved ones at the facility who were not able to have their phones on them at work.

KNOWN TO AUTHORITIES

Throughout Friday morning, some expressed relief as they managed to contact loved ones, while others struggled to reach works, questioning FedEx's policies.

Indianapolis Mayor Joe Hogsett said the community must guard against resignation and “the assumption that this is simply how it must be and we might as well get used to it.”

President Joe Biden said he had been briefed on the shooting and called gun violence “an epidemic” in the U.S.

MOST READ IN US NEWS SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'COUNTERACTION' Taliban threatens attack after Biden pushed back Afghanistan withdrawal TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

Thursday's attack was the third mass shooting in Indianapolis this year.

Five people, including a pregnant woman, were shot and killed in the city in January, and a man was accused of killing three adults and a child before abducting his daughter during at argument at a home in March.

Elsewhere, eight people were fatally shot in massage businesses across Atlanta last month, and 10 people were shot in a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado.
summary:
A VIGIL for the innocent victims of the FedEx shooting has taken place in Indianapolis.
Deandra Dycus, whose 13-year-old son was injured after being hit by a stray bullet, led the vigil.
Other vigils are set to take place to honor the victims of the shooting, including one at 7pm.
13 A woman hugs a girl during the vigil Credit: AFP13 A poem was performed during the vigil in Indianapolis Credit: Getty Images - GettyIt comes as photographs of some of the eight victims were revealed.
It marks the latest in a string of mass shootings across America in recent weeks, also becoming the third mass shooting in Indianapolis this year.

title: Tour guide gang-raped by five men and a WOMAN at five-star hotel in India
text:
A TOUR guide was gang-raped by five men and a WOMAN at a five-star hotel in India, according to police reports.

The rape survivor named six people who attacked her in the hotel near India Gate in Delhi on Friday.

3 Rape and sexual violence has been rife in India in recent years Credit: AFP or licensors

A man from the Sheikh Sarai area of Delhi has been arrested in connection with the brutal attack.

Police said the tour guide made a distressed call the day after the incident, which happened in a five-star central Delhi hotel room.

The room had been booked under the names of two businessmen, according to reports.

The survivor said the accused called her to the hotel under the pretext of granting her a loan at low rates because she was in "dire need of money."

Deputy Commissioner of Police, New Delhi, Eish Singhal told NDTV: "On the victim's complaint, a case was registered against 6 accused persons including one woman.

"The victim was lured to the hotel room on the pretext of providing a loan at subsidized rates by the accused persons.

"The victim worked as a tourist guide-cum-ticket booking agent and she was in dire need of money.

"The room was booked under the name of two business persons."

RAPE HORROR

Police are further investigating the other people accused.

Earlier this month, a teenage girl claimed she was raped by an ambulance driver as she was taken to hospital for coronavirus treatment in India.

The 29-year-old is said to have launched the sex attack on the 19-year-old as she was driven to a treatment centre.

And in August, another horrific sex attack was reported after a teenager was raped and murdered before her "mutilated" body was found dumped in a sugarcane field.

The 13-year-old girl's father claims her tongue had been cut and her eyes gouged out - although police have disputed this, according to reports.

The alleged incident took place in Pakaria village close to the Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh’s Lakhimpur Kheri district.

Nearly 34,000 rapes are reported in India each year despite the introduction of tougher laws in recent years.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Rape and sexual violence has been under the spotlight in India since the 2012 gang rape and murder of a young woman in the capital Delhi, which prompted thousands demanding stricter laws.

Prison sentences for rapists were doubled to 20 years as well as well as criminalising voyeurism, stalking and trafficking of women.

Indian MPs also voted to lower the age at which a person can be tried as an adult for heinous crimes to 16 from 18.

3 The attack occurred in a hotel in Delhi, India Credit: Getty Images - Getty
summary:
A TOUR guide was gang-raped by five men and a WOMAN at a five-star hotel in India, according to police reports.
The rape survivor named six people who attacked her in the hotel near India Gate in Delhi on Friday.
Police said the tour guide made a distressed call the day after the incident, which happened in a five-star central Delhi hotel room.
"The victim was lured to the hotel room on the pretext of providing a loan at subsidized rates by the accused persons.
3 The attack occurred in a hotel in Delhi, India Credit: Getty Images - Getty

title: Kristin Smart ‘murder’ suspect Paul Flores probed over ‘3 sex assaults’ as cops urge possible victims to come forward
text:
THE former classmate accused of murdering Kristin Smart during an attempted rape in 1996 has been linked to three new sexual assault cases, police say.

Paul Flores was detained for the murder of Smart on Tuesday, but the Los Angeles Police Department has since confirmed that it's also investigating three separate sexual assault allegations against the 44-year-old.

12 Paul Flores, a 44-year-old former classmate of Smart's, was arrested on Tuesday in San Pedro, California Credit: AP

12 Police say Flores murdered Smart while attempting to rape her - and his father later helped him bury her body Credit: Handout

Detectives with the LAPD told FOX11 that three sexual assault cases against Flores have been presented to the Los Angeles County District Attorney's Office for filing.

The cases reportedly involve three separate victims on three separate dates. The department offered no further information.

The local DA's office will now decide if there's sufficient evidence to pursue charges in relation to each of the allegations.

In a press conference on Wednesday, San Luis Obispo District Attorney Dan Dow asked the public to come forward with any information they may have about Flores committing additional crimes, including "assaults or other acts."

Dow said investigators believe Flores may be responsible for another sexual assaults in the Los Angeles area, adding he often frequented bars near his home in San Pedro from 2005 up until his arrest.

“Evidence of other sexual crimes may be used,” Dow said. “We intend to use evidence of other sexual crimes to prove the [Smart case].

"If you've been a victim in another location, perhaps in San Pedro, we want you to come forward to law enforcement so that you can get assistance that you need and it may help us in this particular case as well."

As reported by The Sun on Wednesday, Flores has previously been accused of rape and of sexual assault - with some of those allegations pre-dating the disappearance of Smart.

Its' unclear if any of those prior allegations are among the three cases of sexual assault currently being investigated by the LAPD.

One of those accusers was even a student at California Polytechnic State University when she claims Flores assaulted her - months before Smart disappeared from the campus on May 25, 1996, having last been seen alive with Flores.

12 While Flores had long been deemed a suspect in Smart's disappearance, two years before she vanished, Flores was allegedly accused of raping a girl in 1994 Credit: AP

12 Flores was the last person to see 19-year-old Smart alive, having walked her home from an off-campus frat party back to her dorm at California Polytechnic State University, on Memorial Day weekend in 1996 Credit: Getty Images - Getty

12 Ruben Flores, 80, has been charged as an accessory to murder Credit: Rex

The first of those accusations allegedly took place in 1994, when a woman, identified only as Jane, claims Flores roofied, raped and discarded her when she was a 15-year-old sophomore in high school.

She claims Flores handed her a drink and she passed out. She claims she later came to, to find Flores "on top of me. I know I didn’t have any pants on and he was in me and I could feel him,” she told The Daily Beast.

"He was staring at my face looking at me and he was enjoying himself.”

After that, Jane says she blacked out. The next thing she remembers, she claims, was being dragged down a dimly lit street, with Flores pulling her by one of her arms, and his friend pulling her by the other.

“They took off running,” Jane said. “I remember thinking: ‘If my mom’s not home I’m going to die right here.’”

Jane's mother reportedly rushed her to hospital, and her father called police.

According to Jane, however, Arroyo Grande cops sided with Flores, favoring with his story that she willingly drank and had sex that night.

"We can’t do anything because [Paul] and his friend are saying she was drunk and it was consensual," Jane claimed police told her.

“I was like ‘It wasn’t. I blacked out and didn’t consent to anything.’”

When contacted by the Daily Beast, the Arroyo Grande Police Department initially said they couldn't find any records relating to the case. Another spokesperson said the case fell under a "non-disclosure category" and therefore they wouldn’t be providing any specific information about it.

The Sun has reached out to AGPD for further clarity.

12 Paul Flores pictured being taken into custody on Tuesday Credit: AP

Later, in 1995 - just months before Smart vanished - a Cal Poly student, who identified herself as Sarah, told The Beast Flores used to "stalk" her.

At a Halloween party that year, Sarah claims Flores grabbed her crotch on the dance floor.

“He grabbed me down there and while I’m yelling at him my girlfriend threw a piece of gum at his face and he pushes her down.”

Responding to the fracas, a group of male attendees reportedly chased Flores out of the function.

Later the same year, she claims Flores once again pursued her at another party, when she sat down to go to the bathroom and he "kicked the door open."

"He slammed me and then pushed me up against the inside wall by the toilet, his hands were on my upper arms and he started telling me all these sick things he was going to do to me," Sarah claimed.

After Flores allegedly told her he was going to "rape" her, she says she kneed him in the groin and kicked him the shin, before alerting others.

Sarah's ex-boyfriend says he was among those that raced to confront Flores.

Corroborating Sarah's story, he told the Beast: "I got in his face. I told him, ‘You never do this again! You never look at her again! If you come near her again I will kill you!’”

One of his friends reportedly pushed Flores through a table and he allegedly fled.

12 Flores pictured in 1996 shortly after Smart's disappearance Credit: Your Own Backyard/ Chris Lambert

Before Flores was suspected in Smart’s disappearance, he was accused of stalking another female on campus.

A police report dated March 27, 1996, said an intoxicated Flores was accused "around Christmas" of attempting to break into a Cal Poly coed’s apartment.

Flores allegedly “climbed up her balcony and she suspected he attempted to break into her apartment," the police reported stated.

The identity of the female student in that incident remains unclear, though no claims of sexual assault were made.

She also refused to press charges, but said she had received countless anonymous phone calls across a period of six weeks that she believed Flores was responsible for.

A third woman, one of Flores' cousins, told the Beast she watched him pin down another of their female cousin's and fondle her beneath her bathing suit during a family vacation in the 1990s.

A fourth accuser, a former girlfriend of Flores', described him to the outlet as sexually aggressive, and recounted how he allegedly held a knife to her face during a sexual encounter in 2002, ignoring her cries of "Stop!" until their roommate burst in to intervene.

12 Cal Poly students seen holding a vigil for Smart on Sunday night Credit: KSBY News

12 The vigil was held hours after Flores and his father were arrested and charged Credit: KSBY News

Paul Flores was arrested for Smart's murder at his San Pedro home on Tuesday.

A former classmate of Smart's at California Polytechnic State University, he was the last person to see her alive, having offered to walk her back to her dorm after an off-campus frat party on Memorial Day weekend, 1996.

Smart never made it home that night was reported missing three days later.

Four different cadaver dogs would later alert to the mattress in Flores' dorm room, signalling for the scent of death.

But numerous falterings in the investigation would follow - including lost evidence and missed leads - leaving Smart's family without answers for 25 years.

However, finally on Wednesday, Dow revealed that prosecutors believe Flores murdered Smart during an attempted rape.

When questioned as to how they believe Flores carried out the killing, Dow refused to divulge details, insisting that information will be shared in court.

He also didn't specify where prosecutors believe the alleged murder took place, but said Flores' dorm room "was a crime scene".

Also detained on Tuesday was Flores' father, 80-year-old Ruben Flores, who police believe helped his son to dispose of Smart's remains.

The arrests came just one month after the younger Flores was identified as the "prime suspect" in Smart's killing, and after cadaver dogs were seen searching Ruben Flores' home in Arroyo Grande.

While immediately considered a person of interest in the case, San Luis Obispo Sheriff Ian Parkinson said Paul Flores officially became a suspect in 2016 after unspecified evidence came to light.

His arrest, alongside his father, followed new evidence investigators acquired in the last two years, Parkinson told the media on Tuesday.

12 Investigators have been searching Ruben Flores home over the last 24 hours, as police say they're close to finding Smart's remains Credit: AP

12 Flores has been charged with first degree murder, which includes the consideration of the sex act Credit: Your Own Backyard/ Chris Lambert

Parkinson said thanks to new witnesses coming forward, and numerous searches of several properties belonging to the Flores' family, investigators were able to uncover forensic and physical evidence tying the father-son duo to Smart's murder.

The Sheriff's office have also been surveying Paul Flores' phone calls and text messages for the last two years, which Parkinson said helped uncover some "helpful" evidence.

The major developments in the case over the last two years were partially credited to a podcast, called Your Own Backyard, which renewed interest in the case upon its release in 2019.

The podcast outlined dozens of accusations of groping, stalking, and sexual assault against Flores from a myriad of former classmates, colleagues and acquaintances.

During the investigation into Smart's disappearance, other students at Cal Poly described Flores as a loner, an outsider, and in some cases predatory.

12 Smart went missing in 1996, and was officially declared dead in 2002 - after a six year search for her yielded no leads Credit: AP

As pointed out by the LA Times in 2006, one friend of Smart's told investigators that she and her friends would refer to Flores as "Chester the Molestor" because he was allegedly renowned for groping girls at parties.

In a police report filed by a campus patrol officer a week after Kristin's disappearance, it was claimed: "Smart does not have any close friends at Cal Poly."

Other students told CBS News that Flores was known as a "creeper", "scary Paul" and said 'You wouldn't want to be alone in a room with him."

Most read in US News SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'COUNTERACTION' Taliban threatens attack after Biden pushed back Afghanistan withdrawal TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

Flores has been charged with first degree murder, which includes the consideration of the sex act, Dow said.

His father, Ruben, has been charged as an accessory after murder and is currently being held on $250,000 bond.

Both of the men are due to be arraigned in court on Thursday.
summary:
Its' unclear if any of those prior allegations are among the three cases of sexual assault currently being investigated by the LAPD.
She claims Flores handed her a drink and she passed out.
At a Halloween party that year, Sarah claims Flores grabbed her crotch on the dance floor.
After Flores allegedly told her he was going to "rape" her, she says she kneed him in the groin and kicked him the shin, before alerting others.
Flores allegedly “climbed up her balcony and she suspected he attempted to break into her apartment," the police reported stated.

title: YouTuber Jake Paul ‘forced TikTok star to perform oral sex’ on him
text:
TIKTOK star Justine Paradise claims YouTuber Jake Paul sexually assaulted her in July 2019 at his home in Los Angeles.

The 24-year old alleged in a YouTube video that Paul, also 24, assaulted her at the Team 10 house, where he lives with several friends.

5 TikTok star Justine Paradise alleged that Jake Paul sexually assaulted her. Credit: YouTube/Justine Paradise

The US Sun reached out to Paul's representation for comment but did not receive a response at the time of publication.

The pair met through a mutual friend, and when they first encountered one another, Paradise believed they were going to a “studio” to hang out, which turned out to be the Team 10 residence.

Paradise said in the video that she was aware of Paul, but hadn’t watched his videos and did not know she would be meeting him.

Right away, she said, Paul asked for her phone number, and they began a series of text exchanges starting in June 2019. The alleged assault happened in July during one of the few times they were alone together at the house.

She claimed the YouTube star would invite her over, but then not interact with her in person while she was there, calling him “awkward.” She added that girls would come over and “basically throw themselves at him," and, “He would go to his room with a different girl, multiple different girls every day."

5 Paradise claimed the alleged assault took place at the Team 10 house. Credit: Instagram

Paradise noted that Paul was “nice” to her until the day of the incident, when he kissed her and she got the sense that he was doing it in front of his friends to “show off” before inviting her to his room.

The TikTok star claimed Paul seemed impressed when she was asking about his past, but she wasn’t sure if that was “just a card he plays.”

After they talked a bit, Paradise claimed, “We were dancing in his room, like ballroom dancing,” before Paul led her to his bed, where they kissed and she said she would move his hands if she wasn’t comfortable with where he was placing them.

Finally, she alleged, Paul said, “If nothing is going to happen, what's the point?"

5 The TikTok content creator claimed “I couldn't tell him to stop." Credit: YouTube/Justine Paradise

Paradise said in the video that “Sex is very special and very important to me," and that, “Normally, everybody respects me when I don't want to do sexual things, so I thought that it was fine if I went in his room and I thought it would be fine to kiss him, because I thought he would stop if I didn't want to do anything else."

But Paradise alleged that instead of just continuing to make out or asking her to leave, Paul then “undid his pants and grabbed my face and started f**king my face.”

The TikTok content creator claimed “I couldn't tell him to stop," and that Paul “just shoved himself in me, he didn't ask for consent or anything. That's not OK. On no level at all is that OK."

“He knew I didn’t want to do anything with him,” she said in the nearly 21-minute video.

5 Paul said, “If nothing is going to happen, what's the point?" Paradise alleged. Credit: AP

Paradise said that after the alleged assault, Paul didn’t even want to let her clean herself up before they went back downstairs.

“Why would you sexually assault me and then not even let me fix my hair and makeup?” she questioned in the YouTube upload.

The 24-year-old woman said he was “straight-up rude” after the incident and did a “complete 180.” Before, she said, “He had been nice to me, he had been sweet to me.”

Paradise noted she tried to get in touch with Paul after because “I wanted to talk to him about how that made me feel,” but that he stopped responding to her after that date.

5 “I think about it every single day,” Paradise said of the alleged assault. Credit: YouTube/Justine Paradise

“I never got an apology,” she said. “Just because I let you kiss me and I let you hold my hand and I let you dance with me in your room, that doesn’t give you the right…”

Paradise said one of the reasons she waited to speak out was because she signed a nondisclosure agreement, and that "I thought that if you sign an NDA, you're signing away your rights to talk about anything basically.”

The TikTok star said she ultimately decided to say something because “The more and more I think about it, the more I realize no one could be doing that and think that it’s something right to do.”

“I think about it every single day,” she said.

Most read in News SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'COUNTERACTION' Taliban threatens attack after Biden pushed back Afghanistan withdrawal TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

Paradise also thought calling Paul out publicly might make him address it, or at least be a warning to other girls who could find themselves in a similar situation.

“Even if you don't believe me, at least it will be in the back of your mind when you're with him,” she said.

If you or someone you know is affected by any of the issues raised in this story, call RAINN (Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network) at 800-656-HOPE (4673).
summary:
TIKTOK star Justine Paradise claims YouTuber Jake Paul sexually assaulted her in July 2019 at his home in Los Angeles.
5 TikTok star Justine Paradise alleged that Jake Paul sexually assaulted her.
The alleged assault happened in July during one of the few times they were alone together at the house.
Finally, she alleged, Paul said, “If nothing is going to happen, what's the point?"
Paradise alleged.

title: TI & Tiny look tense as they’re seen out in public for first time since claims they drugged and forced victims into sex
text:
TI and his wife Tameka “Tiny” Harris are seen out in public for the first time since being accused of multiple sex assaults against at least 11 women.

The Atlanta-based stars and their children were spotted enjoying a night out at the famous BOA Steakhouse in West Hollywood.

12 T.I. and Tiny head to the BOA Steakhouse in West Hollywood Credit: BackGrid

12 The famous couple were with members of their family Credit: BackGrid

12 The group smiled as they posed for pictures before heading inside the restaurant Credit: BackGrid

TI, wearing a white hoodie with “Cookies” written on the front and Tiny, 45, in a gray hoodie, stood maskless as they posed for photographers outside the celebrity hotspot.

Father-of-six TI, whose real name is Clifford Harris, 40, refused to discuss the sex assault allegations when asked to comment by the photographers.

But his Atlanta-based lawyer, Steve Sadow, has vehemently denied all the allegations made against the Grammy-winning star and his wife which according to victims’ attorney Tyrone A. Blackburn include "eerily similar" alleged instances of rape, drugging and kidnap over several years.

No criminal charges have been brought against the couple and Mr Sadow told The Sun on behalf of his clients after the restaurant visit: “The Harrisses continue to absolutely deny these scurrilous and unsubstantiated accusations made by attorney Blackburn’s clients.

12 T.I. arrived wearing a facemask but took it off as he walked inside Credit: BackGrid

12 The couple were happy to pose for photographs Credit: BackGrid

“We await Blackburn exposing his anonymous accusers to the light of day by revealing their names.

“Only then will we be in a position to confront their allegations with true facts.

“By the lawyer choosing instead to misuse the media for his own publicity and hiding the identities of his clients from the public and us, he makes it impossible for us to comment further now.

“We remain confident that if the claims are thoroughly and fairly investigated, no charges will be brought.”

Also speaking exclusively to The Sun, New York-based Mr Blackburn said his phone has been “ringing off the hook” with more alleged victims since he gave a press conference announcing he would be representing 11 women in late February.

12 The group paused for a few moments before heading inside the famous restaurant Credit: BackGrid

He also insisted the women’s claims “are not an attempt at a shakedown” and he is “determined to get justice” and will not reveal the alleged victims' identities “for their own protection.”

Mr Blackburn said at a virtual press conference on February 28 he has contacted attorney generals in California and Georgia with “eerily similar” claims from the victims - who do not know each other - dating from 2005 up to 2017 or 2018, which include allegations of “sexual abuse, forced ingestion of illegal narcotics, kidnapping, terroristic threats and false imprisonment.”

One woman, a military veteran, alleges that in September 2005, Tiny gave her a drugged drink in an LA hotel room during which TI massaged her and tried to put his foot in her vagina.

She refused and remembers waking up naked on a couch.

Another woman says she was 17 and an intern at the couple’s Atlanta studio in the summer of 2006 when Tiny told her to take off her dress to cool down.

12 Lawyer Tyrone A. Blackburn, who is based in New York, is representing several alleged victims of T.I. and his wife

She says she passed out and woke up with a bleeding vagina.

She alleges she was driven to a pharmacy by another of the couple’s employees for emergency contraception and was threatened not to talk about the incident.

Another woman claims in 2007 she was introduced to a security guard by Tiny and the guard then stalked her and two months later allegedly held a gun to her head, blindfolded her, put her in a car, raped her three times over 24 hours and threatened to kill her if she talked about it.

“My phone has been ringing off the hook since the press conference,” Mr Blackburn said.

“There is a myriad of stories and I am currently working through their claims.

12 Tiny wore a gray hoodie as she went into the venue Credit: BackGrid

“I need to check that everyone I deal with has evidence of their claims or a witness to back up their accounts.”

He also told of the “years of suffering” the women had experienced following their alleged attacks, including being suicidal.

“When these victims are drugged, there’s no one way it affects them," he said.

“Unfortunately, for some of the women, they’ve had to go to outpatient clinics and they’ve suffered drug addiction that stems from the alleged interactions with Mr and Mrs Harris.

“One woman was very suicidal after her alleged encounter with Mr and Mrs Harris.

12 The couple were travelling around LA in a black SUV Credit: BackGrid

“It has also impacted their ability to have meaningful relationships with men.

“And it’s a good question as to why they’ve hired a man to represent them.

“It has been hard for me to win over their trust.

“It has been hard to get them to believe when I say that the only goal we have is getting justice for them.

“They will never be made whole from a conviction but at least pieces of them can be put back intact, just knowing that what happened to them did not go unchecked.”

12 T.I. has had a hugely successful career spanning music and movies Credit: Getty

He also told The Sun: “I’ve spoken to two attorney generals’ offices so far, I cannot disclose details about what was said or what was passed on.

“I do not want to jeopardise any investigation that may be forthcoming.

“Right now it’s just discussions.

“But I am taking this seriously and I will not rest until there is a chance for justice.

“The decision for the investigation is not up to me, it is up to prosecutors.

12 T.I. and Tiny were married in 2010 Credit: Getty Images - Getty

“They have to make the decision, do they want Mr and Mrs Harris to go around allegedly drugging 17 year olds.

“They have to make the decision, do they want to have Mr and Mrs Harris going around allegedly trying to insert a foot into the vagina of a veteran.

“They have to make the decision do they want them to allegedly play a role in holding someone against their will for three days and force them to engage in sex acts.

“I do not want to re-victimise these women again through something I said or that a key piece of evidence is not allowed to be used.

“I have to be very careful.

“This is not about money, it is about justice. It's why I will not name these women, their identities must be protected.

“I’ve never asked the Harrises or their legal counsel for a dollar and I do not intend to.”

12 The couple's former friend Sabrina Peterson was the first to make an allegation of violence against T.I. Credit: Instagram

He told The Sun he was “not shocked” and “not surprised” about the number of women now coming forward.

Mr Blackburn said: “If you look at Jeffrey Epstein, if you look at Harvey Weinstein, those types of cases, victims take time to come forward.

“It is hard for them to do.

“These women have gone through several stages of grief and disbelief since they were victimised.

“At first it can be hard to believe that what happened to them actually did, that it was real.

“Then they have to weigh up speaking to the authorities and ask themselves if they think they can be believed.

“They’re intimidated by the profile of the victimiser and the public profile the victimiser has.

“And they don’t want the spotlight on them, or the vitriol that can be directed at them from the supporters and fans of the attacker if they are identified.

“The attacker also has a lot of financial means to pay for lawyers, to pay off officials.

“The Harrises have also made some direct threats to the women over the years.

“A lot of times, these women haven’t told their parents, co-workers, partners, families, their loved ones, their spouses what happened to them.

“These are horrific stories but thankfully the women are now finding the courage to speak about it.”

Most read in Celebrity SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'FIGHT BACK' Professor on leave of absence after bashing student who called police ‘heroes’ TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

TI and Tiny's former friend Sabrina Peterson triggered the complaints against the couple after she alleged in January in an online post that TI had once held a gun to her head.

The couple deny Sabrina's allegations and Sabrina is now suing TI and Tiny for defamation.
summary:
TI and his wife Tameka “Tiny” Harris are seen out in public for the first time since being accused of multiple sex assaults against at least 11 women.
Another woman says she was 17 and an intern at the couple’s Atlanta studio in the summer of 2006 when Tiny told her to take off her dress to cool down.
12 Lawyer Tyrone A. Blackburn, who is based in New York, is representing several alleged victims of T.I.
“My phone has been ringing off the hook since the press conference,” Mr Blackburn said.
Mr Blackburn said: “If you look at Jeffrey Epstein, if you look at Harvey Weinstein, those types of cases, victims take time to come forward.

title: PCSO mum Julia James, 53, WAS murdered say cops, as it’s revealed dog stayed with body in woods after her death
text:
A PCSO mum who was found dead in a Kent woodland was murdered while she walked her dog, cops revealed today.

The body of Julia James, 53, was tragically discovered in Akholt Wood in Snowdown, near Dover - with her loyal dog staying with her body until she was found, neighbours claimed.

15 Police have told neighbours that her dog stayed with Julia James' body until it was discovered

15 Julia James, who was a serving PCSO with Kent Police, was found dead near Dover yesterday Credit: Kent Police

15 Forensics officers are at the scene today after Mrs James' body was found yesterday Credit: Paul Edwards / The Sun

Forensic officers today flooded the scene where the mother's body had been found as neighbours paid tribute to the "bubbly" woman.

Neighbour Sean Simmonds, 57, a paramedic, said that officers told him Mrs James’s loyal white Jack Russel had stayed with her body after she was killed while on a walk with her beloved pet.

He said: "The police have been doing door to door knocks. They told us the dog stayed with her. They found the dog with her."

Locals said Ms James regularly walked her Jack Russell terrier dog, which us believed to be called Toby, along the secluded country footpaths.

The horror happened just two-and-a-half miles from Chillenden, where mum and daughter Lin and Megan Russell, as well as dog Lucy, were murdered in 1996. Lin's older daughter Josie, then nine, suffered horrific injuries but survived the attack.

It is understood PCSO Julia had taken her dog for a walk after working from home.

And Sean added: “She talked about her job lots.

“She was always in a good mood, smiling. She didn’t seem to be under any stress."

The community was today in shock after the tragic discovery, with local Leah Southwell, 18, saying Julia was always happy.

Leah said: "She was out walking her dogs at the time of the incident.

"She was so happy. So bubbly, if you were having a bad day she’d be there smiling at you and trying to make you laugh.

"They are the best neighbours you can have."

She was such a happy woman. She was so happy and bubbly." Neighbour Leah Southwell

Another neighbour broke down in tears when he paid tribute to grandmother Julia as Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate launched a murder investigation.

He said: “It’s heartbreaking - absolutely tragic. I can’t believe it. She was a loving mum and the pillar of the community.

“This is devastating. She was a lovely woman. A terrific part of the community.

“It was a great comfort having a PCSO there. They’re a lovely family.”

Mrs James had two grown up children - a daughter who also works for the police and a 23-year-old son.

While Kent Police have insisted they are treating the tragedy as a suspicious death, the Major Incident Public Portal, which witnesses can use to submit potentially vital information, described it as a 'murder' codenamed Operation Sark.

National Police Federation chair John Apter tweeted: "Police have launched a murder investigation after ⁦@kent_police⁩ PCSO Julia James was found dead in remote Snowdown woods. My heart goes out to Julia’s family, friend and her colleagues. This is devastating news."

Police have not revealed how the popular officer died but a post mortem is due to be held to establish the exact cause of death.

The family is now being supported by police family liaison officers.

15 Julia James' family is being supported by officers after the tragedy Credit: SWNS

15 Officers found the 53-year-old's body and an investigation has been launched Credit: UkNewsinPictures

15 Police search the woodlands for clues Credit: Steve Finn

15 Neighbours said Julia was out walking her dog at the time of the tragedy Credit: Facebook

15 Julia James, 53, was found dead in woodland near Dover, Kent

15 The serving PCSO was said to have been a proud officer with Kent Police Credit: Facebook

15 Police have launched an investigation into the suspicious death Credit: UkNewsinPictures

15 Kent Police officers continued to search for clues following the discovery of the serving PCSO's body yesterday Credit: UkNewsinPictures

Officers were seen guarding a field alongside Aylesham Road while several more fields were also sealed off with one officer saying it was a "very big crime scene".

An aerial image from the scene appears to show a police tent set up next to floodlights in a nearby field.

Police have not revealed how the popular officer died but a post mortem is due to be held to establish the exact cause of death.

Kent Police also refused to say if Mrs James, who is believed to have served in the domestic violence unit, was on duty or off duty when she died.

Mrs James, who lived in Aylesham, Kent, became a PCSO in 2007.

Before joining the force, she worked for Kent County Council in a learning resource centre but wanted to get out and about more.

'SUSPICIOUS' DEATH

After becoming a PCSO for Tenterden in 2013, she said: "I am a people person and love being in the community. The people in Tenterden are very friendly."

A Kent Police spokesman said: "Officers were called shortly after 4pm on Tuesday to Akholt Wood in the Aylesham Road area of Snowdown where the body of a woman, aged 53 was found.

"The victim is a serving Kent Police PCSO Julia James.

"No arrests have been made at this time but detectives from the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate are conducting enquiries to establish the circumstances and her death is being treated as suspicious.

"Officers are keen to speak to anyone who was in the area on Monday 26 and Tuesday 27 April who may have seen something unusual or suspicious."

Dozens of police cars were seen heading to the scene this morning. No arrests have been made at this time.

The victim is a serving Kent Police PCSO Julia James." Kent Police

Assistant Chief Constable of Kent Police Tom Richards said: "Officers are carrying out a number of lines of enquiry to establish the circumstances and people in the Snowdown area will see an increased police presence as a result.

"It saddens me to confirm that the victim was a serving PCSO for Kent Police and whilst there is a full and thorough investigation underway our thoughts also remain with her family, friends and colleagues.

"It is vitally important that anyone who was in the area on Monday and Tuesday who may have seen something suspicious gets in touch with us.

"We’re particularly keen to speak to those who regularly visit the area who may have seen something out of place and those who drove by who have dashcam footage.

"We would advise anyone in the area to remain vigilant until the full circumstances of the death are established."

A spokesman for the Kent Police Federation, which represents rank and file officers within the constabulary, said: "Very sad news today as Kent Police confirms the death of PCSO Julia James.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

"The thoughts of Kent Police Federation and our members are with Julia’s family, friends and close colleagues at this sad and difficult time."

Home Secretary Priti Patel also tweeted, saying: "So saddened to hear of the death of Kent Police PCSO Julia James. I offer my sincere condolences to Julia’s friends, family and colleagues at this awful time."

Officers are keen to speak to anyone in the area on Monday or Tuesday who may have seen something unusual or suspicious.

Anyone with information should call 0800 0514526 or can submit video footage online.

The Chillenden murders Julia James' body was found in Snowdown, Kent - just two-and-a-half miles from Chillenden. In 1996, Michael Stone slaughtered Dr Lin Russell, 45, and her six-year-old daughter Megan, along with the family dog. He also tried to kill nine-year-old Josie Russell, who miraculously survived the horror. The family were tied up, blindfolded and attacked with a hammer as they walked in a country lane in the Kent village. Following the horrific incident, Josie and her father Shaun moved to Dyfrryn Nantlle, Gwynedd, Wales Online reported. And Josie has gone on to see great success as an artist. She got engaged in 2018, when she said she hopes to be a mum. Stone's earliest chance of release will be in 2023, when he will be 63. Lawyers acting for him have claimed there is "compelling evidence" linking Levi Bellfield to the Russell killings.

So saddened to hear of the death of @kent_police PCSO Julia James.



I offer my sincere condolences to Julia’s friends, family and colleagues at this awful time. https://t.co/8gfqmA14yV — Priti Patel (@pritipatel) April 28, 2021

15 Officers were seen searching for evidence close to a bridleway near the woods Credit: Steve Finn

15 Mrs James, a serving PCSO, was found dead in a tiny Kent hamlet yesterday Credit: UkNewsinPictures

15 Cops last night closed off the only road through Snowdown, home to just over 50 properties Credit: UkNewsinPictures
summary:
It is understood PCSO Julia had taken her dog for a walk after working from home.
National Police Federation chair John Apter tweeted: "Police have launched a murder investigation after ⁦@kent_police⁩ PCSO Julia James was found dead in remote Snowdown woods.
Home Secretary Priti Patel also tweeted, saying: "So saddened to hear of the death of Kent Police PCSO Julia James.
The Chillenden murders Julia James' body was found in Snowdown, Kent - just two-and-a-half miles from Chillenden.
So saddened to hear of the death of @kent_police PCSO Julia James.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell ‘ordered room full of underage girls to kiss and dance in front of Epstein’, unsealed court docs claim
text:
GHISLAINE Maxwell directed a room of girls to “kiss, dance and touch one another in a sexual way” and smeared Prince Andrew’s sex accuser as a drug addict, bombshell court papers claim.

The heiress – currently locked up on child grooming charges – saw her sex secrets laid bare after 112 court documents running to thousands of pages were released by a US judge.

4 Ghislaine Maxwell is accused of being involved in Jeffery Epstein's sex trafficking ring Credit: Getty Images - Getty

They stem from a lawsuit between the socialite and Epstein sex slave Virginia Roberts, who says she was forced to sleep with the Duke of York three times as a teenager – which he denies.

The shocking court documents include testimony that Maxwell and Epstein had sex sessions with strap-ons and dildos.

A former employee claimed Maxwell forced girls into an orgy, according to the court papers.

They also repeat a previous claim that she stole a 15-year-old’s passport to get her to have sex with Epstein.

One document reads: “One witness (redacted) was in tears, as he recounted (Maxwell) bringing a 15-year-old girl into his employer’s home who, in utmost distress, told him that (Maxwell) stole the young girl’s passport and tried to make her have sex with Epstein and then threatened her.

“(Redacted) also testified that he watched Maxwell direct a room full of underage girls to kiss, dance, and touch one another in a sexual way for (Maxwell) and Epstein to watch.

“Another witness (redacted) testified that (Maxwell) recruited her from her school campus to have sex with Epstein with lies about being her personal assistant.”

4 Maxwell tried to smear Epstein sex slave Virginia Roberts as a drug addict, court documents claim Credit: Nine

The court documents also claims that Maxwell tried to smear Virginia, now 36, by alleging that she had an “opioid addiction” and had previously “cried rape” as a teenager.

She is said to have branded Virginia a “professional victim” and “sexually permissive” by digging up police reports involving the American mum-of-three from when she was younger.

Maxwell, 59, is jailed in New York awaiting trial on charges that she procured girls for Epstein’s sex trafficking ring and took part in the abuse.

She denies the charges.

Earlier this week she tried to get the charges dropped, claiming she was protected by Epstein's sweetheart non-prosecution deal in 2007.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Epstein hanged himself in jail in New York in 2019.

Prince Andrew has said he does not remember ever meeting Virginia Roberts and denies they had any sexual contact.

He also denies being aware of any wrongdoing during his friendship with Epstein.

4 Maxwell is in jail awaiting trial in New York Credit: Reuters
summary:
GHISLAINE Maxwell directed a room of girls to “kiss, dance and touch one another in a sexual way” and smeared Prince Andrew’s sex accuser as a drug addict, bombshell court papers claim.
The shocking court documents include testimony that Maxwell and Epstein had sex sessions with strap-ons and dildos.
A former employee claimed Maxwell forced girls into an orgy, according to the court papers.
They also repeat a previous claim that she stole a 15-year-old’s passport to get her to have sex with Epstein.
“(Redacted) also testified that he watched Maxwell direct a room full of underage girls to kiss, dance, and touch one another in a sexual way for (Maxwell) and Epstein to watch.

title: Evil stepdad beat boy, 5, to death so badly he ‘looked like car crash victim’ then said ‘I should kill a kid more often’
text:
AN EVIL stepdad beat a five-year-old boy to death with such ferocious violence he looked like a car crash victim, an inquest has heard.

Days later James Roberts joked with the boy's mother: "We should kill a kid more often" as they lapped up gifts and money from wellwishers.

5 Leon Jayet-Cole had at least 44 injuries including head trauma similar to a car crash victim

5 Stepdad James Roberts beat the five-year-old four times a week after moving in with his mother Emma Jayet

Roberts beat Leon Jayet-Cole and other children in the house up to four times a week after moving in with their mother Emma, a coroner heard.

Their natural father Michael Cole suspected abuse and warned social services.

But a damning coroner's verdict today found social workers, police and health officials failed to stop it.

It came at the end of a long-running inquest that began in 2018 in Christchurch, New Zealand.

Little Leon, who was on the autistic spectrum, died in hospital in May 2015.

A day earlier Roberts called an ambulance claiming he found him pale and not breathing.

He told police he had heard a bang while he was on the phone to Leon's mother and went to check on him a few minutes later.

But a post-mortem revealed 44 injuries, including severe blunt force head trauma, a broken jaw, spinal bleeding and a broken foot.

Doctors told the inquest his head injuries were more typically seen in car crash victims or people who fall from a height above 20 metres (66ft).

5 Social workers and police failed to save Leon Jayet-Cole, a coroner ruled

Police found a fresh hole in the plasterboard in the hall, which was probably made by Leon's head.

Roberts explained it with an unlikely story about "a dog's bum" in his police interview and also lied about the cause of his own hand injury.

Detectives suspected him of murder and planted a recording device in the home, the inquest heard.

On June 1, four days after Leon died, Roberts and Emma were heard talking about the gifts and money they had received.

Roberts said the "new stuff" was incredible and added: "We should kill a kid more often."

He was also recorded saying he and Emma should "do something cool for the kids", such as going to Fiji.

Roberts was probably on drugs when he made the admission "in jest", said Det Sgt Chris Power.

COVER-UP

Investigators believe Roberts beat the children for three years in a chaotic home environment in which he and his wife regularly used drugs.

Traces of heroin and methamphetamine were found in Leon's hair - indicating he had ingested the drugs in his last months.

Roberts was charged with murder but dodged justice when he died in jail in June 2016 while awaiting trial.

Leon's mother Emma Jayet was accused of lying to police and social workers when she gave evidence to the inquest in 2019.

She said she never saw Roberts hit her children in the three years they lived together, and would have left him if she suspected he might hurt them.

But the coroner heard social workers had twice forced her to take a child to hospital with "horrific" bruising after she had refused to seek medical help.

Just days before Leon's fatal head injury he suffered a broken foot caused by stomping.

Emma claimed she didn't notice any swelling and he seemed normal.

5 James Roberts threatened to kill Leon's dad when he reported concerns to social services

5 Roberts died in jail while awaiting trial for murder Credit: NZ police

In earlier evidence, Leon's dad Michael Cole said he had repeatedly warned social workers the kids were in danger.

He said the children seemed scared of their stepdad and were "utterly miserable".

After he filed a complaint to social services, Roberts texted him threatening to kill him and his partner and rape her autistic son.

In a damning verdict, coroner Brigitte Windley ruled police, doctors and child protection staff failed to protect Leon and his siblings.

She said they did not share information or link the mounting evidence of abuse, despite the “enormous resources” devoted to the family.

She said: “The risk of violence in this case went undetected until Leon was killed."

The coroner was also damning about Leon's mother, ruling that she probably gave false statements to authorities.

She said: “It is difficult to escape the conclusion that Emma knew or suspected that James had been harming the boys, and that from time to time she covered for him."

And gullible social workers swallowed the lies “when any objective analysis would have indicated that caution and scepticism were required”.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

After today's verdict, Michael said he was hurt the Christchurch health board appeared to be "passing the buck", and he had no faith the Ministry for Children would make improvements.

“Try to put yourself there," he told Stuff.co.nz.

"It was a nightmare knowing kids were in danger and just being ignored.

"They helped put him in the grave.”
summary:
AN EVIL stepdad beat a five-year-old boy to death with such ferocious violence he looked like a car crash victim, an inquest has heard.
But a damning coroner's verdict today found social workers, police and health officials failed to stop it.
He told police he had heard a bang while he was on the phone to Leon's mother and went to check on him a few minutes later.
Leon's mother Emma Jayet was accused of lying to police and social workers when she gave evidence to the inquest in 2019.
And gullible social workers swallowed the lies “when any objective analysis would have indicated that caution and scepticism were required”.

title: Who is John Cannan? Main suspect in the Suzy Lamplugh case
text:
MORE than three decades after London estate agent Suzy Lamplugh disappeared, police dug up the garden of the house where prime suspect John Cannan's mum once lived.

Lamplugh, 25, was abducted in 1986 after going to meet a client to show him two houses in Fulham. She was declared dead, presumed murdered, in 1994.

5 Suzy disappeared in July 1986 and has never been found Credit: Rex

5 John Cannan remains the prime suspect for Suzy's murder Credit: Rex

Who is John Cannan?

Cold case detectives named Cannan as the prime suspect of the Lamplugh’s murder in 2002.

However, the Crown Prosecution Service said there was not enough evidence to prosecute Cannan, now 67, who has already been convicted and jailed for a series of crimes.

John Cannan is currently held in Full Sutton prison for the murder of another woman, newlywed Shirley Banks, in 1987.

In 1989 he was convicted of rape, attempted abduction, murder and attempted robbery following a series of crimes against young professional women.

On the evening before his murder of Banks, Cannan had attempted to kidnap another woman, and he was also found to have raped a third at knifepoint in Reading, Berks, a year earlier.

The crimes saw him given three life sentences, and despite originally being given a whole life tariff, this was later reduced to a minimum 35-year sentence.

He had since attempted to appeal the mandatory 35 years, which has been rejected.

5 Suzy's father Paul went to his grave without any answers Credit: Rex Features

Cold case detectives named Cannan as the prime suspect in November 2002 after the Crown Prosecution Service rejected their attempt to charge him, deeming there was insufficient evidence to prosecute.

A fellow prison inmate came forward after the naming, saying that Lamplugh was buried under the patio at Cannan's mother’s house.

Detectives now believe Cannan may have driven to what was then his mother’s home following the suspected murder.

But there were many other clues which suggested Cannan was Mr Kipper long before this tip-off.

An important one was that he was given the nickname “Kipper” by others at a bail hostel where he lived at the time of the murder — due to his fondness for the fish and a habit of having a kip.

What happened to Suzy Lamplugh?

Lamplugh, 25, was abducted in 1986 after going to meet a client named “Mr Kipper” to show him two houses in Fulham.

But, after the mystery house viewing, Lamplugh was never seen again.

Over the decades, police have chased up a number of leads relating to the disappearance, but have continued to draw blanks.

Lamplugh was declared dead, presumed murdered, in 1994.

Are there any other suspects in the Suzy Lamplugh case?

Another suspect in the Suzy Lamplugh case is serial killer Steven Wright - also known as the Suffolk Strangler.

According to reports from Entertainment Daily, Lamplugh worked as a beautician on the ocean liner Queen Elizabeth 2 in 1982.

At the same time Steven Wright was working as a steward.

Steve Wright is a convicted serial killer, the murders taking place over a few months at the end of 2006.

He is known as the Suffolk Strangler and the Ipswich Ripper.

Before his arrest his only criminal activity on record was theft, which is how his DNA was identified in connection with the murders.

Steve Wright had a gambling addiction and was in debt.

5 Paul Lamplugh And Diana Lamplugh - Suzy's parents Credit: Rex

He had attempted suicide twice - once through gassing himself, the second through a pill overdose.

Most read in News HEIR THIS William & Charles 'won't open their arms to Harry again' after Oprah interview SPORE BLIMEY NHS worker 'living in horror film' with flat covered floor-to-ceiling in mould HOW FUEL-ISH Quick-thinking motorists spray car thieves with PETROL in forecourt robbery MIND THE GAP Homeowner's fury after extension leaves neighbour's house inches from his home KNIFE HORROR Boy, 17, stabbed to death after being 'chased into shop & knifed' before crash COPS SLAMMED Noel Clarke accuser says cops didn't investigate after he 'filmed her naked'

Wright’s father, Conrad Wright, told the Mirror he was “troubled” by pictures of Steven Wright with estate agent Suzy, before she vanished in 1986.

The Metropolitan Police investigated Wright in 2008 in relation to Lamplugh’s disappearance.

However, a senior Met police officer described the link as “speculative”.
summary:
MORE than three decades after London estate agent Suzy Lamplugh disappeared, police dug up the garden of the house where prime suspect John Cannan's mum once lived.
5 Suzy disappeared in July 1986 and has never been found Credit: Rex5 John Cannan remains the prime suspect for Suzy's murder Credit: RexWho is John Cannan?
Cold case detectives named Cannan as the prime suspect of the Lamplugh’s murder in 2002.
Are there any other suspects in the Suzy Lamplugh case?
Another suspect in the Suzy Lamplugh case is serial killer Steven Wright - also known as the Suffolk Strangler.

title: Woman, 22, tortured to death by gang-rapists who dumped her bleeding on doorstep in India’s second horror murder in days
text:
TWO men have been arrested on suspicion of the rape and murder of a 22-year-old woman in India.

This comes just two days after another Indian woman died after she was brutally gang raped two weeks ago.

3 Indian police say two men named Shahid and Sahil have been arrested for rape and murder of the 22-year-old Credit: BALRAMPUR POLICE TWITTER

The tragic young woman’s devastated family say her legs and ribs were broken as she was tortured during the attack, although officials have not confirmed the injuries.

The woman, who reports claim to be part of the lower-caste Dalit community, had been working at a private firm last Tuesday night.

However, the young woman didn’t return to her home in Balrampur that night.

The injured woman was finally brought home by rickshaw in the early hours of Wednesday morning in a “bad condition” with a drip still pierced into her arm.

Tragically, the young woman died on the way to the hospital.

Balrampur Superintendent of Police Dev Ranjan Verma said two youths named Shahid and Sahil have been arrested for rape and murder.

“We received a complaint in which the kin of the woman informed that she worked at a private firm and on Tuesday she did not return till late night,” he said.

VIOLENT PROTESTS ERUPT

“Later in the wee hours of Wednesday, the girl came on a rickshaw in a bad condition with [a] glucose drip attached to her arms. She was soon rushed to a hospital but died on the way.

“The family members have alleged that two youths raped the girl and took her to some doctor.

"When her condition deteriorated, instead of taking her to a hospital they brought her back to her home.”

Indian police have today imposed emergency laws in the village where a 20-year-old woman as raped and murdered.

DIED FROM SHOCK

Local cops have banned more than five people from gathering after violent protests erupted over the attack.

In the latest case, some 280 miles away, the deputy inspector general of police, Rakesh Singh, said that “shock and haemorrhage” were the cause of death.

“Whether she was sexually assaulted or not will be examined by medical experts,” he added.

India is one of the world’s most dangerous countries for women, with a rape occurring every 15 minutes, according to government figures from 2018.

But campaigners say the issue is far bigger than that, with sexual violence against women hugely under-reported, despite prison sentences for rapists now standing at 20 years.

Members of the Dalit community - formerly known as “untouchables” - are at the bottom of the strict Hindu caste hierarchy in India.

MORE NEWS FROM INDIA DEADLIEST DAY India suffers record 3,689 Covid deaths as wards and crematoriums overwhelmed SWEAT & TEARS Indian mum, 35, with Covid suffocates in hospital car park waiting for bed COVID CHAOS 30 Aussie IPL cricketers stranded in Covid-hit India face JAIL if they fly home DEADLY BLAZE India Covid hospital fire kills 18 as virus crisis spirals out of control CRISIS CALL Biden bans travel from India as Americans are urged to leave NOW PROCEED WITH CAUTION What to know about the new travel restrictions

According to human rights organizations, Dalit women are particularly vulnerable to caste-based discrimination and sexual violence.

Last month, a 13-year-old Dalit girl was raped and killed in Uttar Pradesh.

In December last year, a 23-year-old Dalit woman in the same state died after being set ablaze by a gang of men as she made her way to court to press rape charges.

If you are affected by any of the issues raised in this article, please call the Samaritans for free on 116123.

3 Protests erupt in New Delhi following the rape and murder of a 20-year-old woman Credit: AFP or licensors
summary:
TWO men have been arrested on suspicion of the rape and murder of a 22-year-old woman in India.
This comes just two days after another Indian woman died after she was brutally gang raped two weeks ago.
However, the young woman didn’t return to her home in Balrampur that night.
Tragically, the young woman died on the way to the hospital.
3 Protests erupt in New Delhi following the rape and murder of a 20-year-old woman Credit: AFP or licensors

title: Corey Feldman accuses ‘obsessed’ Marilyn Manson of ‘decades long mental and emotional abuse’
text:
COREY Feldman last night accused Marilyn Manson of “decades long mental and emotional abuse” and "messing with my life".

The former child actor, 49, claimed gushing Manson was "obsessed" with him and called him his idol – before trying to manipulate him as a "toy".

5 Corey Feldman shared this photo on Instagram claiming it was the moment his 'nightmare began' Credit: Instagram

5 He claimed Marilyn Manson was 'obsessed' with him and called him his 'idol' Credit: Instagram

It comes after at least 11 women made abuse allegations against the goth rocker.

Corey posted a photo on Instagram of them together on the evening he claims his "nightmare" began more than 20 years ago.

The Goonies star said: “The night @marilynmanson tried 2 use & abuse me as his play toy by trying 2 manipulate me N2 breaking my 5 yrs of sobriety 2 snort cocaine w him, while gaslighting me 4 his press tour on #MechanicalAnimals was where the decades long mental & emotional abuse began.

"Luckily I was not physically harmed that night as we got out safely, but that was just the beginning of my nightmare!

"#ISTANDWITHEVAN & any & all survivors of his demented abuse!"

Actress Evan Rachel Wood's allegations of "horrific abuse" by her ex-fiance unleashed a torrent of similar claims by other women this week.

Corey, who has campaigned to expose child abuse in Hollywood, posted in support of Evan and the other accusers.

5 At least 11 women have accused Marilyn Manson of abuse Credit: EPA

5 Corey Feldman has campaigned to expose child abuse in Hollywood Credit: Getty Images - Getty

He added: "Manson has been obsessed w me 4 over 2 decades! Don’t #BELIEVE me? Just LOOK @ THE PUBLISHED FACTS!

"He 1st wrote several passages about me in his book #LONGROADOUTOFHELL as we had met a few months prior 2 that @ a premier in NY where the #GROOMING process began.

"He grabbed my face in front of the crowd and kissed me w his black lip stick that I couldn’t rub off all night.

"He proceeded 2 gush over me telling me what a 'Huge fan' of mine he was. He then introduced me 2 his BFF #BILLYCORGAN.

"All of this is documented in his book! He brags about it as if I was a special needs person he was making fun of."

Corey added: "Manson heavily pursued a friendship w me. Telling me I was his idol.

"Telling me he actually got his whole style by watching my film #DREAMALITTLEDREAM & my character #BOBBYKELLER was the inspiration 4 his entire look.

"Idk if that was #TRUTH but he used it as a way 2 manipulate me.

5 Corey Feldman, left, as Bobby Keller in the 1989 film Dream A Little Dream with Corey Haim. Credit: Kobal Collection - Shutterstock

"Months later he called me on Xmas morning, 2 wish me a 'merry Christmas' & invite 2 a dinner party around the release of his book, @ the fancy Indian Hollywood hang Dar Macrabe where customers sit around on pillows as in traditional Indian style.

"When I walked in the rm it was quite clear that I was the 'guest of honor' as the whole room stopped 2 take pictures of the moment as he hugged me, then grabbed my hand, & led me 2 the table by his side.

"THE PIC IS FROM THAT MOMENT! We later went back 2 his home where the nightmare began. He has messed w my life ever since."

Manson has not responded to Corey's claims.

Westworld star Evan Rachel Wood, 33, went public last Monday with allegations her ex-fiance tortured and raped her during years of "horrific abuse".

Last night she also posted on Instagram, accusing Manson of using racist insults and wearing Nazi tattoos.

At least 11 other women have come forward with similar claims.

Manson was ditched by his record label and also dropped by his manager of 25 years in the wake of the allegations.

He has called the allegations "horrible distortions of reality" and insisted all his relationships were consensual.

On Wednesday night police swarmed on his LA mansion for a welfare check after someone inside was reportedly heard screaming.

Most read in News SICK TROPHY Charles Manson booking sheet from Manson family murders on sale for $95k GRAY ESCAPE Elderly couple use military training in Morse code to bust out of senior home 'FIGHT BACK' Professor on leave of absence after bashing student who called police ‘heroes’ TOUCHDOWN SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts lands in Gulf of Mexico after leaving ISS CASINO HORROR Two dead as gunman opens fire at casino before being shot dead by police Exclusive WORLD'S STRONGEST GRANDMA Powerlifter, 71, hits back at claims she's 'too old' for the gym

Corey Feldman has previously detailed the alleged abuse he suffered while working as a child star in 1980s teen movies including Stand By Me, The Goonies and The Lost Boys.

He has spoken of the "dangerous" dark underbelly of the industry and claimed there was a powerful "Hollywood pedophile ring".

Last year a documentary claimed he and fellow child star Corey Haim were raped by leading industry figures.

If you or someone you know is affected by any of the issues raised in this story, call RAINN (Rape, Abuse, & Incest National Network) at 800-656-HOPE (4673).
summary:
COREY Feldman last night accused Marilyn Manson of “decades long mental and emotional abuse” and "messing with my life".
Corey, who has campaigned to expose child abuse in Hollywood, posted in support of Evan and the other accusers.
5 At least 11 women have accused Marilyn Manson of abuse Credit: EPA5 Corey Feldman has campaigned to expose child abuse in Hollywood Credit: Getty Images - GettyHe added: "Manson has been obsessed w me 4 over 2 decades!
5 Corey Feldman, left, as Bobby Keller in the 1989 film Dream A Little Dream with Corey Haim.
Last year a documentary claimed he and fellow child star Corey Haim were raped by leading industry figures.
